description: Let x(1)x(2)...x(q) denote the decimal expansion of a number n > 9. a(n) is the number of iterations needed to reach the end of the cycle under the map n -> f(n) where f(n) is represented by the number y(1)y(2)...y(q) such that y(k) = (x(k) + x(k+1)) mod 10 for k = 1..q-1 and y(q) = (x(q) + x(1)) mod 10.
